                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Masuda Qureshi</h1>

<h2 class="heading">MA in Early Modern Studies 2016-17</h2>








<h4 class="heading">Why did you choose to study Early Modern Studies at UCL? </h4>



<p class="p">After choosing predominantly modules on the Early Modern period during my undergraduate studies I decided that there was a lot more to learn. <br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">What are / were the highlights of the MA?</h4>



<p class="p">As this MA is interdisciplinary I was able to choose from 40 modules across different departments at UCL; this was particularly useful as my interest lies in Early Modern science. We also had trips to places like the Royal Society, St Brides Library (where they have an actual printing press from the seventeenth century), and the National Archives. <br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">What skills do you think you’ve learned from your MA that will be / are useful for your career?</h4>



<p class="p">I loved learning palaeography; it helps when I look for original research material in manuscripts. I started off very flaky but managed to learn quite a lot in a short space of time. <br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">What do you hope to do when you graduate?</h4>



<p class="p">I am planning on doing a PhD in Early Modern literature and its relation to science. The work for the MA, especially the annotated bibliography, helped me shape my research proposal and also secure two PhD places. I cannot express how invaluable this experience was. <br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">What advice would you give to prospective students considering Early Modern Studies at UCL?</h4>



<p class="p">Do not worry if you don’t know what you will work on just yet. The MA will shape the way you think about the period and there is always something new and exciting to work on. <br /><br /></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  <h2 class="heading">Quote from external examiner</h2>
<p class="p">  &quot;<em>The teachers on the Early Modern MA bring out the best in their students,<br />challenging them to go as far as they can. Even the weaker candidates did very well indeed thanks to excellent support. I was very impressed by the<br />quality of the essays and the scholarly rigour and conceptual ambition evident in the best dissertations</em>.&quot; Professor Barbara Ravelhofer, Durham University<br /></p>

  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;

    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";

  };

  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Meet our students</h1>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/images/study/palaeography" width="890" height="400" alt="early modern palaeography class ucl" class="large-image" title="early modern palaeography class ucl" /><p class="p">Early Modern Studies students come from diverse backgrounds and go on to 
diverse careers. We aim to create a relaxed,enjoyable and interactive environment in which students can 
share their own experiences and ideas so as to learn from one another - 
building peer networks to carry into future careers. <br /></p>
<p class="p">To learn more about
 the UCL Early Modern Studies experience explore the graduate profiles 
below. <br /></p>
<p class="p"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/masudaqureshi">Masuda Qureshi</a></p>
<p class="p"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/harrychancellor">Harry Chancellor</a><br /></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

  <h2 class="heading">A statement from UCL for EU applicants</h2>
<a class="image" href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eu-referendum/accordion/current-new-eu-students" title="EU flag, image credit Hakan Dahlstrom on Flickr" target="_self"><img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/images/study/eu_flag_Hakan_Dahlstrom_flickr.jpg" width="890" height="400" alt="EU flag, image credit Hakan Dahlstrom on Flickr" class="large-image" title="EU flag, image credit Hakan Dahlstrom on Flickr" /></a>

</section>

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  <h2 class="heading">Quote from external examiner</h2>
<p class="p">  &quot;<em>The teachers on the Early Modern MA bring out the best in their students,<br />challenging them to go as far as they can. Even the weaker candidates did very well indeed thanks to excellent support. I was very impressed by the<br />quality of the essays and the scholarly rigour and conceptual ambition evident in the best dissertations</em>.&quot; Professor Barbara Ravelhofer, Durham University<br /></p>


</section>

<footer class="footer wrapper"> 
    <div class="footer__inner clearfix">
        


        


        



        <article class="block block--col-1">
            <h2 class="as-h5">UCL facilities</h2>
            <ul class="footer__list list-unstyled">
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/departments/faculties">Faculties and departments</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/library/">Library</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/museums">Museums and Collections</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.thebloomsbury.com/">UCL Bloomsbury Theatre</a></li>
            </ul>
        </article>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Optional Modules</h1>
<p class="p">Modules are the individual units of study which lead to the award of credit. MA EMS students take 45 credits of optional modules.</p>
<p class="p">You can choose any relevant modules from across UCL, and other Colleges within the University of London. We have compiled a list of suggested modules, which are loosely grouped by subject areas. You are welcome to take other modules not on the list, as long as they are relevant.</p>






<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Crossing the Channel: Early Modern England in a global context</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="40%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  Code
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Title
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Dept
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Credits
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Term
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Day
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Time
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  CLASGR12B
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/classics/study/postgraduate/ma/Accordion/degrees/reception/ma-reception" target="_self">Approaches to the Reception of the Classical World</a>
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Classics
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  15<br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  1 or 2<br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Thu
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  2-4pm
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  HISTG053A
</td>
<td class="align-left">
   <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/history/current-students/graduate-taught/modules/modern" target="_self">Continental Connections: Britain and Europe in the Eighteenth Century</a>
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  History
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  15
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  1
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Thu
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  2-4pm
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td class="align-left">
  EDITG006
</td>
<td class="align-left">
   <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/confessional">Confessional Cultures in the Dutch Republic &amp; England, c.1500-c.1700 </a>
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  CELL
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  15<br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
   2
</td>
<td class="align-left">
   Fri
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  2-4pm
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Expanding Horizons: Exploration, Circulation and Discovery</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="40%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<col width="10%" class="align-left" />
<tbody>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  Code<br />

<p class="p">There are also a variety of <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie/CourseUnits/Documents/CourseCodes-MFL-G.pdf" target="_self">modern foreign language graduate modules</a>, including French, Italian or Spanish for Academic Purposes, or Translation Skills. <br /></p>
<p class="p">There is also a non-assessed, extra-curricular <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/mars/seminars-lectures/latin-reading" target="_self">reading group</a> focused on Latin texts from the Renaissance period for 
those wishing to improve their Latin through the reading and translation
 of historical texts.</p>

</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td class="align-left">
  HARTG080
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/current-students/course-options" target="_self">Seeing Through Materials: Matter, Vision and Transformation in the Renaissance</a><br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  History of Art<br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  30<br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  1&amp;2<br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  Mon <br />
</td>
<td class="align-left">
  2-4pm<br />
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
</dl>
 

</div>





<h4 class="heading">Choosing modules</h4>



<p class="p">When choosing your optional modules you will need to:<br /></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Contact the administrator in the department/College who is offering the module. Please be aware that departments are entitled to give priority to their own students. After that places are allocated on a first-come-first-served basis. </li>
<li>Check your modules don’t clash. You can find out when a module takes place on the <a href="https://timetable.ucl.ac.uk/tt/homePage.do">online timetable</a> by using the 'custom search' function. </li>
<li>Make sure your course-load is balanced across both terms.</li>
</ul>
<p class="p"><strong>Questions?</strong> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/multidisciplinary-and-intercultural-inquiry/new-students-accordion" target="_self">FAQs about choosing modules and enrolling </a></p>



<h4 class="heading">Registering modules</h4>



<p class="p">Once you have formally enrolled at
UCL, you need to register your module choices on Portico. Please register your
modules as soon as you can and <strong>before the end of
the first week of term</strong>. To register your modules on Portico, you must have registered with UCL. The UCL webpage <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/new-students/select-modules" target="_self">Select Modules</a> explains how to register your modules.</p>


<!-- End Silva content -->

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Modules</h1>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/images/study/cicero" width="890" height="400" alt="Young Cicero Reading by Vincenzo Foppa, study early modern" class="large-image float-right" title="Young Cicero Reading by Vincenzo Foppa, study early modern" /><p class="p">Early Modern Exchanges is pleased to offer a range of modules for taught graduate students. These courses are open to any students whose programme allows it.</p>
<p class="p"><strong>Modules available in 2017-18</strong></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/core">ARTFGE01A Reframing the Renaissance</a> (15 credits, term 1)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/forging">ARTFGE01B Forging the Early Modern</a> (15 credits, term 2)</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/unstitching" target="_self">ARTFGE05 Unstitching the Early Modern: Archival and book skills</a> (15 credits, term 1)</li>
<li>EDITG002, IT for Graduate Research - CANCELLED FOR 2017/18</li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/web01">EDITG005 Web 0.1: Early Modern Information Culture c.1470-1750</a> (15 credits, term 2)</li>
<li>EDITG006 Confessional Cultures in the Dutch Republic &amp; England, c.1500-c.1700 - CANCELLED FOR 2017/18</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Priority will be given to students on the MA in Early Modern Studies. After that places are allocated on a first-come-first-served basis. Please contact the Centre Coordinator, <a href="mailto:lucy.stagg@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Lucy Stagg</a>, to reserve a space, and before registering the module on Portico.</p>
<p class="p">We also offer the following module, through the Spanish department. The contact for this module is <a href="mailto:patrizia.oliver@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Patrizia Oliver</a></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/postgraduate-taught/ma-modules/ma-modules-2017-18/spang013a-sex-and-the-body-in-early-modern-europe" target="_self">SPANG028 Sex and the Body in Early Modern Europe</a> (15 credits, term 1)</li>
</ul>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <!--noindex-->

         

         
              

<footer class="footer wrapper"> 
    <div class="footer__inner clearfix">
        


        


        



        <article class="block block--col-1">
            <h2 class="as-h5">UCL facilities</h2>
            <ul class="footer__list list-unstyled">
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/departments/faculties">Faculties and departments</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/library/">Library</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/museums">Museums and Collections</a></li>

  }

})();

    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }

  };

  doc.close();
})();

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Reframing the Renaissance</h1>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/images/study/exchanges" width="890" height="400" alt="Gdansk by Wojciech Gerson, early modern exchanges" class="large-image float-right" title="Gdansk by Wojciech Gerson, early modern exchanges" /><p class="p"><strong>Code</strong>: ARTFGE01A<br /><strong>Value</strong>: 15 credits<br /><strong>Tutor</strong>: Taught by a variety of tutors (changes year on year)<br /><strong>Time &amp; Location</strong>: Term 1, Tuesdays, 2-4pm, use <a href="https://timetable.ucl.ac.uk/tt/createCustomTimet.do" target="_self">UCL 'Custom Timetable'</a> to check rooms</p>
<p class="p">One of the crucial developments of the period we term ‘the Renaissance’ or ‘early modern’ was the rise of a multitude of cultural forms in the vernacular, in contrast to the medieval Latinate world that had gone before. We will look at how these changes developed in different European countries from their origins in Italy to Spain, England and France. As well as charting these key shifts in cultural practice, we incorporate sessions that introduce crucial changes in material practice, focusing on print culture, communication networks, and visual, aural and material culture. These sessions are designed to complement and dialogue with other modules on the MA in Early Modern Studies that develop the necessary skills for carrying out original research for the dissertation and towards doctoral study, i.e. historical bibliography and the study of manuscript material. In addition to weekly seminar discussion, we will visit libraries, archives and sites of special interest including the National Portrait Gallery, and these visits will include sessions on object-based learning.</p>
<p class="p"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/docs/reframing">Course handbook 2017-18, containing schedule, reading lists etc</a> (pdf)<br /></p>


<h3 class="heading">Assessment</h3>




<p class="p">ARTFGE01A is assessed by one 4,000-word essay on a topic of your choice, to be discussed and agreed with the course convenors. Essays should be submitted via Turnitin on Moodle and are due according to the deadlines set out in the Moodle handbook for the module.</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <!--noindex-->

(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/forging"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/forging">Forging the Early Modern</a>
                
            </li>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Forging the Early Modern</h1>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/images/study/forge" width="890" height="400" alt="The Iron Forge, early modern, Joseph Wright, 1773" class="large-image float-right" title="The Iron Forge, early modern, Joseph Wright, 1773" /><p class="p"><strong>Code</strong>: ARTFGE01B<br /><strong>Value</strong>: 15 credits<br /><strong>Tutor</strong>: Taught by a variety of tutors (changes year on year)<br /><strong>Time &amp; Location</strong>: Term 2, Tuesdays, 2-4pm, use <a href="https://timetable.ucl.ac.uk/tt/createCustomTimet.do" target="_self">UCL 'Custom Timetable'</a> to check rooms</p>
<p class="p">This module starts by examining the epistemological challenges that transformed the early modern world from the creation of a global trading system to the cartographic innovations that helped to map it and the travel writing that explored the vastly expanded horizons of early modern European thought. The course focuses on a number of issues in the cultural and intellectual history of the period, as researchers lead sessions demonstrating how the relationship between theory and archival research can result in new insights into the early modern as a critical concept. Field trips which facilitate engagement with material forms and physical practice in the period include the Victoria and Albert Museum and the Royal Society Library.<a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/docs/coremodulehandbook" target="_self"><br /></a></p>
<p class="p"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/docs/forging">Course handbook 2017-18, containing schedule, reading lists etc</a> (pdf)<br /></p>


<h3 class="heading">Assessment</h3>




<p class="p">ARTFGE01B is assessed by an annotated bibliography / literature review (4,000 words long) which can be used to help define and begin to research the topic of the dissertation. Students should discuss their literature reviews with the course convenors or appropriate course tutor. Essays should be submitted via Turnitin on Moodle and are due according to the deadlines set out in the Moodle handbook for the module.</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">

        <script src='//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/skins/UCLIndigoSkin/default-theme/main.js'></script>
        <script>require(['app/general','theme/indigo-autocomplete-ga','theme/silva','app/searchWithAutoComplete','app/lightbox',]);//load the default stuff</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/unstitching"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/unstitching">Unstitching the Early Modern: Archival and book...</a>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Unstitching the Early Modern: Archival and book skills</h1>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/images/study/bookkeeper" width="890" height="400" alt="Bookkeeper by van Dijk, handwriting manuscript culture" class="large-image float-right" title="Bookkeeper by van Dijk, handwriting manuscript culture" /><p class="p"><strong>Code</strong>: ARTFGE05<br /><strong>Value</strong>: 15 credits<br /><strong>Tutor</strong>: <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/people/staff/robyn-adams" target="_self">Dr Robyn Adams</a><br /><strong>Time &amp; Location</strong>: Mondays, 10-12 noon, term 1. Use <a href="https://timetable.ucl.ac.uk/tt/createCustomTimet.do" target="_self">UCL 'Custom Timetable'</a> to check rooms</p>
<p class="p">This course provides intensive training in the essential skills required for postgraduate research in the period 1500-1800 and focuses mainly on two areas; paleography and book history.<br /><br />The paleography section introduces the handwriting and scripts of early modern England (1500-1800) and manuscript culture. Knowledge of these scripts is essential for students wishing to pursue archival research. In addition, this course provides access to the resources required for archival research, such as provenance markers and situating the source material in its historical context. <br /><br />The book history section is intended as a primer towards advanced bibliographical research and study which focuses on textual history. It equips the student with the resources, methodological questions and techniques required for understanding the historical context and processes of book production in the early modern period. The course combines practical research skills with a program of key areas of historical bibliography and history of reading. <br /><br />The course is practical, and is taught on-site within the UCL Special Collections reading room facilities, using carefully chosen material from the stacks. There are also two field trips to archives and institutions and the opportunity to meet and gain hands-on experience from leading manuscript and textual scholars.<br /><br />This course will be a core module for the MA in Early Modern Studies from September 2018.<br /><strong>Assessment</strong>: One 4000 word essay (100%)<br /></p>
<p class="p">Coursework should be submitted via the Moodle course<a href="https://moodle.ucl.ac.uk/course/view.php?id=37799" target="_self"></a>, and according to the deadlines set out therein.</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
        <!--noindex-->

    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);

  };

  doc.close();
})();

    <nav class="breadcrumb clearfix">
        <ul class="breadcrumb__list">
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk">UCL Home</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme">Early Modern Exchanges</a>

                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules">Modules</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/web01"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/web01">Web 0.1: Early Modern Information Culture, c.14...</a>
                
            </li>
        </ul>
    </nav>

                    <!--endnoindex-->
                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Web 0.1: Early Modern Information Culture, c.1450-c.1750</h1>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/images/study/bookwheel" width="890" height="400" alt="Ramelli's bookwheel, early modern information culture" class="large-image float-right" title="Ramelli's bookwheel, early modern information culture" /><p class="p"><br /> <strong>Code</strong>: EDITG005<br /><strong>Value</strong>: 15 credits<br /><strong>Tutor</strong>:<a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/people/staff/matthew-symonds" target="_self"> Dr Matthew Symonds</a><br /><strong>Time &amp; Location</strong>: Fridays, 10am-12pm, term 2. Use <a href="https://timetable.ucl.ac.uk/tt/createCustomTimet.do" target="_self">UCL 'Custom Timetable'</a> to check rooms</p>
<p class="p">It is a truism that we live in an information society and that this is a new and unprecedented state of affairs. This module seeks to historicise the concept of the information society through the study of the cultural and intellectual history of early modern Europe.</p>
<p class="p">The rediscovery and popularisation of classical learning, the explosion of printed material, and the birth of a modern concept of scientiﬁc knowledge presented a challenge to scholars and states across Europe: how to organise, use, and share information in an age where there was – in the words of Ann Blair – “too much to know”.</p>
<p class="p"><strong>Assessment</strong>: One 3000 word essay (100%)</p>
<p class="p">Coursework should be submitted via the Moodle course, and according to the deadlines set out therein.</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

  }

})();

    href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/news" class="navitem">News &amp; Events</a></li>

    href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/resources"
    class="navitem">Resources</a></li>

    href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/contact-us"
    class="navitem">Contact Us</a></li>
                    
                
            
        </ul>
    </nav>


    
	</div> <!-- end .wrapper -->

    </header><!-- end #nav-wrap -->

    <!--endnoindex-->

        <div class="wrapper site-content">
            <!--noindex-->
            <header class="header header--mobile default-header">
	<a class="header header__open" href="#">
				<img src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/images/mob-nav.png" alt="Menu">
			</a>
</header>


            <!--endnoindex-->
            <div class="site-content__inner clearfix">
                <div class="site-content__body">
                    <!--noindex-->
                    
    <nav class="breadcrumb clearfix">
        <ul class="breadcrumb__list">
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk">UCL Home</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme">Early Modern Exchanges</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study">Study</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd">Graduate Research</a>
                
            </li>
        </ul>
    </nav>

                    <!--endnoindex-->
                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Early Modern Studies MPhil/ PhD</h1>
<p class="p">We have <a href="/silva/eme/people">over forty leading scholars</a> associated with Early Modern Studies at UCL. <br /></p>
<p class="p">If you are interested in completing a PhD in Early Modern Studies we can help you identify an appropriate supervisor. Email the director, <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/mailto: a.samson@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Dr Alex Samson</a>, or the coordinator, <a href="mailto:lucy.stagg@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Ms Lucy Stagg</a><br /></p>
<p class="p">For more information on how to contact potential supervisors and write a research proposal please see UCL's <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/supporting-materials/research/potential-supervisor.pdf">guidance document</a> (PDF, 70KB). <br /></p>

<h2 class="heading">Research Themes</h2>





<p class="p">  Example themes addressed include: </p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Travel, exile and migration in early modern Europe and the New World
</li>
<li>Trade and flows of material as well as cultural goods within and beyond Europe</li>
<li>Translation, translators and language learning</li>
<li>Literary influences across national, provincial and linguistic borders </li>
<li>Representations of intra- and extra-European ‘others’ in literature and art</li>
<li>Religious and political interactions in the wake of the Reformation</li>
<li>Occasions of significant cultural contact and/or heightened intranational anxiety</li>
<li>The
 production, circulation, and collection of books and manuscripts across
 Europe, the emergence of libraries and the book trade</li>
<li>Dissemination and development of scientific and medical knowledge, spread and transfer of technology</li>
<li>Old
 worlds and New worlds, from botanical and medicinal exchanges to 
pathogens, people and practices, colonialism and ethnography</li>
<li>Interplay
 between past and present, historiography, the archaic, nostalgia and 
the newfangled, classical and medieval pasts, archaeology and material 
cultures.</li>
</ul>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">Fees and Funding</h2>

<h3 class="heading">Fees</h3>





<p class="p">Fees vary according to individual programmes (e.g. History, English, French etc). Search the <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/www.ucl.ac.uk/graduate/research" target="_self">online prospectus</a> for more details.</p>

<h3 class="heading">Funding</h3>





<p class="p">  It is important that you consider at an early stage how you will fund your graduate research study. <br /></p>
<p class="p"> <strong>Students requiring funding are advised to 
investigate potential sources of funding at least 12 months before the 
relevant academic year so as not to miss scholarship application 
deadlines.</strong></p>
<p class="p">Some relevant funding opportunities for Early Modern students include:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/graduate/UK-EU_Res/grs" target="_self">Graduate Research Scholarship / Overseas Graduate Research Scholarships</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.lahp.ac.uk/apply-for-a-studentship/" target="_self">LAHP Awards</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/jfigs/wolfson-postgraduate-scholarship" target="_self">Wolfson Scholarships</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/scholarships/graduate/" target="_self">Graduate Scholarships &amp; Awards</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ah/scholarships-and-funding/leverhulme-trust-early-career-fellowships" target="_self">Leverhulme Trust Early Careers Fellowships</a></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Further funding may be available through your admitting department.  Search the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/funding/www.ucl.ac.uk/graduate/research" target="_self">online prospectus</a> for more information. Detailed listings can also be found on UCL's central <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships" target="_self">Scholarships and Funding website</a><br /> </p>


</section>

</div>


</div>

                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

    class="navitem">Contact Us</a></li>
                    
                
            
        </ul>
    </nav>


    
	</div> <!-- end .wrapper -->

    </header><!-- end #nav-wrap -->

    <!--endnoindex-->

        <div class="wrapper site-content">
            <!--noindex-->
            <header class="header header--mobile default-header">
	<a class="header header__open" href="#">
				<img src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/images/mob-nav.png" alt="Menu">
			</a>
</header>


            <!--endnoindex-->
            <div class="site-content__inner clearfix">
                <div class="site-content__body">
                    <!--noindex-->
                    
    <nav class="breadcrumb clearfix">
        <ul class="breadcrumb__list">
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk">UCL Home</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme">Early Modern Exchanges</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study">Study</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd">Graduate Research</a>
                <!--[if lte IE 7]>&raquo;<![endif]-->
            </li>
            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/index_right"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/index_right"></a>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 


<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  <h1 class="heading">Fees and Funding</h1>

<h2 class="heading">Fees</h2>





<p class="p">Fees vary according to individual programmes (e.g. History, English, French etc). Search the <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/www.ucl.ac.uk/graduate/research" target="_self">online prospectus</a> for more details.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Funding</h2>





<p class="p">  It is important that you consider at an early stage how you will fund your graduate research study. <br /></p>
<p class="p"> <strong>Students requiring funding are advised to 
investigate potential sources of funding at least 12 months before the 
relevant academic year so as not to miss scholarship application 
deadlines.</strong></p>
<p class="p">Some relevant funding opportunities for Early Modern students include:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/graduate/UK-EU_Res/grs" target="_self">Graduate Research Scholarship / Overseas Graduate Research Scholarships</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.lahp.ac.uk/apply-for-a-studentship/" target="_self">LAHP Awards</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/jfigs/wolfson-postgraduate-scholarship" target="_self">Wolfson Scholarships</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/scholarships/graduate/" target="_self">Graduate Scholarships &amp; Awards</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ah/scholarships-and-funding/leverhulme-trust-early-career-fellowships" target="_self">Leverhulme Trust Early Careers Fellowships</a></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Further funding may be available through your admitting department.  Search the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/funding/www.ucl.ac.uk/graduate/research" target="_self">online prospectus</a> for more information. Detailed listings can also be found on UCL's central <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships" target="_self">Scholarships and Funding website</a><br /> </p>


</section>

</div>



<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-key"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">Fees and Funding</h2>

<h3 class="heading">Fees</h3>





<p class="p">Fees vary according to individual programmes (e.g. History, English, French etc). Search the <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/www.ucl.ac.uk/graduate/research" target="_self">online prospectus</a> for more details.</p>

<h3 class="heading">Funding</h3>





<p class="p">  It is important that you consider at an early stage how you will fund your graduate research study. <br /></p>
<p class="p"> <strong>Students requiring funding are advised to 
investigate potential sources of funding at least 12 months before the 
relevant academic year so as not to miss scholarship application 
deadlines.</strong></p>
<p class="p">Some relevant funding opportunities for Early Modern students include:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/graduate/UK-EU_Res/grs" target="_self">Graduate Research Scholarship / Overseas Graduate Research Scholarships</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.lahp.ac.uk/apply-for-a-studentship/" target="_self">LAHP Awards</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/jfigs/wolfson-postgraduate-scholarship" target="_self">Wolfson Scholarships</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/scholarships/graduate/" target="_self">Graduate Scholarships &amp; Awards</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ah/scholarships-and-funding/leverhulme-trust-early-career-fellowships" target="_self">Leverhulme Trust Early Careers Fellowships</a></li>
</ul>
<p class="p">Further funding may be available through your admitting department.  Search the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/funding/www.ucl.ac.uk/graduate/research" target="_self">online prospectus</a> for more information. Detailed listings can also be found on UCL's central <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships" target="_self">Scholarships and Funding website</a><br /> </p>


</section>

</div>


</div>

                </div>
            </div>

                                  <div class="info">
                                    <h2 class="heading">The resource cannot be found</h2>
                                    <p class="p">
                                      <acronym title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</acronym>:
                                      https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/mailto%3A%20a.samson@ucl.ac.uk
                                      <br /><br />
                                    </p>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>Retype the address.</li>
                                          <li>Use the search box above to find what you're looking for.</li>
                                          <li>Go to <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk" title="UCL Website">www.ucl.ac.uk</a> and look for the information you want.</li>
                                          <li><a href="javascript:history.back()" title="Back to previous page">Go back to the previous page.</a></li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage. 
                                    </p>
                                  </div>

                                  <div class="info">
                                    <h2 class="heading">The resource cannot be found</h2>
                                    <p class="p">
                                      <acronym title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</acronym>:
                                      https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/mphil-phd/www.ucl.ac.uk
                                      <br /><br />
                                    </p>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>Retype the address.</li>
                                          <li>Use the search box above to find what you're looking for.</li>
                                          <li>Go to <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk" title="UCL Website">www.ucl.ac.uk</a> and look for the information you want.</li>
                                          <li><a href="javascript:history.back()" title="Back to previous page">Go back to the previous page.</a></li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage. 
                                    </p>
                                  </div>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Study</h1>

<h2 class="heading">Why study with the Centre for Early Modern Exchanges (EME)?</h2>





<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/images/study/assembly" width="890" height="400" alt="Great Assembly by Bartel van Bassen, study early modern" class="large-image float-right" title="Great Assembly by Bartel van Bassen, study early modern" /><ul class="disc">
<li><strong>Bespoke programmes of study</strong>, rich in their interdisciplinarity; there are <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/about/people">over forty leading scholars</a> associated with the programmes, in a range of subjects including art, digital humanities, history, law, literature, politics and science.
</li>
<li><strong>Practical, hands-on </strong><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/modules">modules</a>, with ‘traditional’ skills such as palaeography and textual bibliography taught alongside the latest techniques in databases and XML.</li>
<li><strong>A large range of </strong><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/options">optional modules</a> and a choice of resources geared to individual research interests.</li>
<li><strong>Privileged access</strong> to a wide range of archives, rare-books libraries and manuscript-related museums in central London.</li>
<li><strong>A vibrant and stimulating research environment</strong> with an extensive
list of <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/news">seminars, performances and other events</a>. </li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Graduate Taught</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma">Early Modern Studies MA</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/modules">Modules 2017-18</a></li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Graduate Research</h2>





<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/mphil-phd">MPhil/ PhD<br /></a></li>
</ul>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Early Modern Studies MA</h1>
<p class="p">With the MA in Early Modern Studies you can tailor a programme to suit 
your interests. The MA can be taken full-time (for one year), or 
part-time, over two years.</p>

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  
<p class="p"><em>&quot;The MA equipped me with skills such as palaeography, manuscript
handling and archival research which are invaluable to my PhD research. The academic staff
are dedicated, supportive and encouraging. I would whole-heartedly recommend
this challenging but highly rewarding MA.&quot;</em> Shani Bans, MA in Early Modern Studies graduate </p>


</section>

</div>



<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/eme-events/images/vanitas" width="890" height="400" alt="Edwaert Collier Vanitas, Early Modern at ucl" class="large-image float-right" title="Edwaert Collier Vanitas, Early Modern at ucl" />

<h3 class="heading">Structure</h3>




<p class="p">Modules are the individual units of study which lead to the award of credit; a module may be worth 15 or 30 credits. In total you will take 180 credits, which will be made up as follows:<br /></p>
<ul class="disc">
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/modules/core">Reframing the Renaissance</a> (15 credits) and <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/modules/forging">Forging the Early Modern</a> (15 credits) - these compulsory modules cover a wide range of disciplines, giving you a broad understanding of the early modern period, and helping you identify areas of interest for further study. </li>
<li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/modules/unstitching" target="_self">Unstitching the Early Modern: Archival and book skills</a> (15 credits) - this compulsory, practical module covers the main skills required for research in the Early Modern period, focusing on palaeography and book history.</li>
<li>Either three 15 credit or one 15 credit and one 30 credit <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/options" target="_self">optional modules</a> (total of 45 credits)</li>
<li> An 18,000 word 
dissertation on a topic of your choice (90 credits)</li>
</ul>
<p class="p">The part-time structure is as follows:</p>



<h4 class="heading">Year 1</h4>



<ul class="disc">
<li>ARTFGE01A Reframing the Renaissance (15 credits, term 1) </li>
<li>ARTFGE01B Forging the Early Modern (15 credits, term 2)</li>
<li>ARTFGE05 Unstitching the Early Modern: Archival and book skills (15 credits, term 1)</li>
<li>An optional module (15 credits, term 2)</li>
</ul>



<h4 class="heading">Year 2</h4>



<ul class="disc">
<li>An optional module (15 credits, term 1)</li>
<li>An optional module (15 credits, term 2)</li>
<li>ARTFGE99 Dissertation (90 credits, term 3)</li>
</ul>


<h3 class="heading"> Teaching and Learning</h3>






<h3 class="heading"></h3>




<p class="p">The programme is very hands-on, with a combination of tutorials, workshops, discussions and library, archive, museum and 
gallery visits. </p>


<h3 class="heading">Find out more</h3>




<p class="p">For more information on the degree, including entry requirements and how to apply see the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/taught/degrees/early-modern-studies-ma" target="_self">online prospectus.</a> There is more information on <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/funding">fees and funding</a> and you can <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/meetstudents">read a student profile</a>. You can also watch a video about the degree below. <br /></p>
<article class="blurb">

    <div class="blurb--video none video--large">
        <div class=" video-wrap ">
	        <iframe frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""
                 src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CF4ieVBiTKI"></iframe>
	        
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="blurb__body">
        <h1 class="blurb__title">Watch a video about the MA in Early Modern Studies</h1>
        <p></p>

    </div>
</article>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

  <h2 class="heading">Quote from external examiner</h2>
<p class="p">  &quot;<em>The teachers on the Early Modern MA bring out the best in their students,<br />challenging them to go as far as they can. Even the weaker candidates did very well indeed thanks to excellent support. I was very impressed by the<br />quality of the essays and the scholarly rigour and conceptual ambition evident in the best dissertations</em>.&quot; Professor Barbara Ravelhofer, Durham University<br /></p>


</section>

    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);

    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

</head>

<h1 class="heading">Fees and Funding</h1>

<h2 class="heading"></h2>

<h2 class="heading">Tuition Fees (2017/18)</h2>





<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';

                 <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">
                            <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                            <p>September 2018</p>
                        </div>
                    

                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        
                            <section style="border-width:0"
    class="threecolumns__column2">
                                <h5>Tuition Fees (2018/19)</h5>
                                <dl class="list--defined">
                                    
                                        <dt>UK/EU:</dt>
                                        <dd>
                                            
                                                <span>
                                                    &#163;10,140 (FT)
                                                </span>
                                            
                                           
                                                <span>
                                                    &#163;5,120 (PT)
                                                </span>
                                            
                                        </dd>
                                    
                                    
                                        <dt>Overseas:</dt>
                                        <dd>
                                            
                                                <span>
                                                    &#163;21,160 (FT)
                                                </span>
                                            
                                            
                                                <span>
                                                    &#163;10,740 (PT)
                                                </span>
                                            
                                        </dd>
                                    
                                </dl>
                            </section>
                        

                        
                    </section>

                    
                        <div>
                            <p>
                                <b>Note on fees:</b>
                                The tuition fees shown are for the year indicated above. Fees for subsequent years may increase or otherwise vary. Further information on fee status, fee increases and the fee schedule can be viewed on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/students/fees">UCL Current Students website</a>.
                                
                            </p>
                        </div>
                    

                    

                    

                   <div>
                        
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>

<h2 class="heading">Funding</h2>





<p class="p"> For a comprehensive list of the 
funding opportunities available at UCL, including funding relevant to 
your nationality, please visit the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding website</a>.</p>



<h4 class="heading">UCL Alumni Scholarship</h4>



<p class="p">  The <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/graduate/UK-EU-Master/uclalumniandfriends/uclalumniandfriendsaccordian/AlumniScholarship" target="_self">UCL Alumni Scholarship</a> aims to enable and encourage 
those who have gained a UCL undergraduate degree to pursue full-time 
Master's degree studies at UCL. </p>


<!-- End Silva content -->

(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

              href="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/respond-x-domain/respond-proxy.html" />

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Harry Chancellor</h1>

<h2 class="heading">MA in Early Modern Studies 2016-17</h2>








<h4 class="heading">Why did you choose to study Early Modern Studies at UCL? </h4>



<p class="p">I chose to do the course, because I intend to do a PhD in literary history, and UCL is a fantastic university!</p>



<h4 class="heading">What are / were the highlights of the MA?</h4>



<p class="p">Enjoying my thesis so far; also, good selection of modules, ‘Early 
Modern Handwriting’, ‘Shakespeare in his Time’, ‘Public Sphere in 
Britain’, all well taught.</p>



<h4 class="heading">What skills do you think you’ve learned from your MA that will be / are useful for your career?</h4>



<p class="p">Developing my research and writing skills for a career in academia or teaching.</p>



<h4 class="heading">What do you hope to do when you graduate?</h4>



<p class="p">Next year I will be doing the first year of my PhD in the UCL English 
department. I hope to gain experience in tutoring alongside this.</p>



<h4 class="heading">What advice would you give to prospective students considering Early Modern Studies at UCL?</h4>



<p class="p">Advice would be to tailor the modules to your particular research 
interests. There are a good selection on offer, and lots of scope for 
doing work in a variety of departments with different methodological 
focuses. Make the course as varied and lively as possible!</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  <h2 class="heading">Quote from external examiner</h2>
<p class="p">  &quot;<em>The teachers on the Early Modern MA bring out the best in their students,<br />challenging them to go as far as they can. Even the weaker candidates did very well indeed thanks to excellent support. I was very impressed by the<br />quality of the essays and the scholarly rigour and conceptual ambition evident in the best dissertations</em>.&quot; Professor Barbara Ravelhofer, Durham University<br /></p>


</section>

            var cuttingTheMustard = document.querySelector && window.localStorage && window.addEventListener;

            Modernizr.load({
                //cutting the mustard as used by the BBC
                test : cuttingTheMustard
                //if old browser load the shiv
                ,nope : [
                    '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/html5shiv-printshiv.min.js'
                    ,'//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/respond.min.js'
                    ,'//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/respond.proxy.min.js'
                ]
            });
            //set conditional assets for main.js
            var globalSiteSpecificVars = {
                pathToJquery: '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-1.9.1.min'
                ,googleAnalyticsIdsArray: ['UA-81353923-1']//specify array of site specific id's NOT UCL generic UA-943297-1
            }
            if(cuttingTheMustard){
                globalSiteSpecificVars.pathToJquery = '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-2.1.1.min';
            }
        </script> 

        <script src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/require.min.js"></script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  <h1 class="heading">Quote from external examiner</h1>
<p class="p">  &quot;<em>The teachers on the Early Modern MA bring out the best in their students,<br />challenging them to go as far as they can. Even the weaker candidates did very well indeed thanks to excellent support. I was very impressed by the<br />quality of the essays and the scholarly rigour and conceptual ambition evident in the best dissertations</em>.&quot; Professor Barbara Ravelhofer, Durham University<br /></p>


</section>

  <h2 class="heading">Quote from external examiner</h2>
<p class="p">  &quot;<em>The teachers on the Early Modern MA bring out the best in their students,<br />challenging them to go as far as they can. Even the weaker candidates did very well indeed thanks to excellent support. I was very impressed by the<br />quality of the essays and the scholarly rigour and conceptual ambition evident in the best dissertations</em>.&quot; Professor Barbara Ravelhofer, Durham University<br /></p>

            <li class="breadcrumb__item">
                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/masudaqureshi"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/masudaqureshi">Masuda Qureshi</a>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Masuda Qureshi</h1>

<h2 class="heading">MA in Early Modern Studies 2016-17</h2>








<h4 class="heading">Why did you choose to study Early Modern Studies at UCL? </h4>



<p class="p">After choosing predominantly modules on the Early Modern period during my undergraduate studies I decided that there was a lot more to learn. <br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">What are / were the highlights of the MA?</h4>



<p class="p">As this MA is interdisciplinary I was able to choose from 40 modules across different departments at UCL; this was particularly useful as my interest lies in Early Modern science. We also had trips to places like the Royal Society, St Brides Library (where they have an actual printing press from the seventeenth century), and the National Archives. <br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">What skills do you think you’ve learned from your MA that will be / are useful for your career?</h4>



<p class="p">I loved learning palaeography; it helps when I look for original research material in manuscripts. I started off very flaky but managed to learn quite a lot in a short space of time. <br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">What do you hope to do when you graduate?</h4>



<p class="p">I am planning on doing a PhD in Early Modern literature and its relation to science. The work for the MA, especially the annotated bibliography, helped me shape my research proposal and also secure two PhD places. I cannot express how invaluable this experience was. <br /></p>



<h4 class="heading">What advice would you give to prospective students considering Early Modern Studies at UCL?</h4>



<p class="p">Do not worry if you don’t know what you will work on just yet. The MA will shape the way you think about the period and there is always something new and exciting to work on. <br /><br /></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  <h2 class="heading">Quote from external examiner</h2>
<p class="p">  &quot;<em>The teachers on the Early Modern MA bring out the best in their students,<br />challenging them to go as far as they can. Even the weaker candidates did very well indeed thanks to excellent support. I was very impressed by the<br />quality of the essays and the scholarly rigour and conceptual ambition evident in the best dissertations</em>.&quot; Professor Barbara Ravelhofer, Durham University<br /></p>


</section>

</div>


</div>

                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

  }

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Meet our students</h1>
<img src="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/images/study/palaeography" width="890" height="400" alt="early modern palaeography class ucl" class="large-image" title="early modern palaeography class ucl" /><p class="p">Early Modern Studies students come from diverse backgrounds and go on to 
diverse careers. We aim to create a relaxed,enjoyable and interactive environment in which students can 
share their own experiences and ideas so as to learn from one another - 
building peer networks to carry into future careers. <br /></p>
<p class="p">To learn more about
 the UCL Early Modern Studies experience explore the graduate profiles 
below. <br /></p>
<p class="p"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/masudaqureshi">Masuda Qureshi</a></p>
<p class="p"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/harrychancellor">Harry Chancellor</a><br /></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

                    </div>
                     <div class="content-sidebar">
                                        <div class="site-content__sidebar">

   Register your interest

 </a>
</p>

<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
  <i class="fa fa-link"></i> 
  <h2 class="heading">Follow UCLEMS_MA</h2>

    <style type>
        .social-buttons--hoz .social-buttons__link--linked {
            background-image: url(//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/images/social-buttons/linkedin.png);
        }
        .workspace .social-buttons__link--linked {
            background:none;
        }
        .social-buttons .social-buttons__list a.social-buttons__link--instagram {
            background-image: url(//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/images/social-buttons/instagram.png);
        }
        .workspace .social-buttons__link--instagram {
            background:none;
        }
    </style>
    
    <div class="social-buttons social-buttons--hoz clearfix">
        <ul class="social-buttons__list">
            <li class="social-buttons__item">
                <a href="https://twitter.com/uclems_ma"
                   class="social-buttons__link social-buttons__link--twitter">Twitter</a>
            </li>
            
            
            
            
            
                        
        </ul>
    </div>


</section>

</div>

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--bar-thin">
  
   
  <h2 class="heading">Quote from external examiner</h2>
<p class="p">  &quot;<em>The teachers on the Early Modern MA bring out the best in their students,<br />challenging them to go as far as they can. Even the weaker candidates did very well indeed thanks to excellent support. I was very impressed by the<br />quality of the essays and the scholarly rigour and conceptual ambition evident in the best dissertations</em>.&quot; Professor Barbara Ravelhofer, Durham University<br /></p>


</section>

                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva"
                   data-href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva">UCL Home</a>

                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme"

                <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/silva/eme/study/early-modern-studies-ma/options"

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Optional Modules</h1>
<p class="p">Modules are the individual units of study which lead to the award of credit. MA EMS students take 45 credits of optional modules.</p>
<p class="p">You can choose any relevant modules from across UCL, and other Colleges within the University of London. We have compiled a list of suggested modules, which are loosely grouped by subject areas. You are welcome to take other modules not on the list, as long as they are relevant.</p>






<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Crossing the Channel: Early Modern England in a global context</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<table class="silvatable plain" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3">
